perturbation.original_text: 1.10. IMPRESSE SITE shall mean the Site located at www.impresse.com (and any successor Site thereto).
perturbation.changed_text: 1.10. IMPRESSE SITE shall mean the domain located at www.impresse.com (and any successor product thereto).
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "Site" with "domain" changes the fundamental definition, while referring to "product" adds another layer of discrepancy. This contradiction blurs what exactly Impresse is responsible for, whether the whole website or just the domain name.

perturbation.original_text: 4.6.1. "VerticalNet Impresse Users" are the Users that register with Impresse through the Co-Branded Site, but specifically excluding those Users who have previously registered with Impresse other than through the Co-Branded Site.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.6.1. "VerticalNet Impresse Clients" are the Clients that sign up with Impresse via the Co-Branded Portal, and specifically excluding those Clients who were formerly signed up with Impresse outside the Co-Branded Portal.
perturbation.explanation: Changing “Users” to “Clients”, “Site” to “Portal,” and “register” to “sign up” without defining these new terms creates confusion. This blurs who the agreement applies to, whether it's just casual site users or paying clients. Also, “via” and “formerly signed up” have been altered to increase ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: 7.6. USER DATA. Impresse shall provide VerticalNet with User Data on each User that submits information through the Co-Branded Site by sending an email with such information to an email address designated by VerticalNet at the time the request occurs. User Data shall be maintained by each Party as Confidential Information of the other Party during the Term and 5 years thereafter, provided such User Data may be disclosed only as part of an aggregation or analysis of all User Data but not as independent data. Upon termination of the Agreement, VerticalNet and Impresse shall jointly own all User Data. Neither Party shall use the User Data other than in accordance with the VerticalNet privacy policy and all applicable laws during the Term and thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.6. CLIENT RECORDS. Impresse will provide VerticalNet with Client Records about each Consumer who submits details through the Co-Branded Channel. This will be done by sending a message with such information to a digital address designated by VerticalNet when the request occurs. Client Records will be kept by each Party as Private Details of the other Party during the Timeframe and 5 years afterward. This implies Client Records may only be revealed if part of a compilation or examination of all Client Records, but not as separate facts. When the Deal ends, VerticalNet and Impresse will jointly possess all Consumer Details. Neither Party is to use the Client Records other than what matches the VerticalNet privacy guidelines and all effective legislations during the Timeframe and forward.
perturbation.explanation: Swapping "User Data" with "Client Records", "User" with "Consumer", "Co-Branded Site" with "Co-Branded Channel", and "Agreement" with "Deal" generates inconsistencies. It remains uncertain whether 'Client Records' are 'User Data' or hold a distinctive importance. Introducing terms like 'Private Details', 'Timeframe', 'Deal', and 'effective legislations' increases ambiguity, causing uncertainty about what information is protected and for how long.
